captions.text: Boom! Headshot, man! Two at once!
Shit, my parents wants me to call my grandma
Can you quit with the jokes and play with me now?
And this, you think it’s a joke?
Google Search: the mobile phone burned my friend but I'm OK
I can’t find anything on the internet. That thing of yours is just weird.
No, there has to be an explanation.
And you don’t know how to look up stuff anyway...
For the console, do I write ‘yes, but with burns’?
Small dinosaur. You want to play with a small dinosaur?
Me too. Me too, I’m okay!
And now… cigarette. You don’t smoke but...
I understand now. You’re allergic to technology.
Arthur, what game are you playing?
No, sir. It’s just that I can’t touch a computer anymore.
If you want to take a day off, all you need to do is ask me nicely. There’s no need to act like a madman.
Would you mind picking that up for me, please?
Your billing calls have been transferred to the Accounts Department.
Yes, that’s what I was working on just now.
Do you mind if you could… just click and drag this file onto the email?
I’m going to make some coffee.
And we’re not going on Facebook, otherwise…
Actually, everything looks fine. It’s just that I’ve never seen this kind of allergic before.
No. I'll speak to a couple of my colleagues about it but… I don’t know.
It’s a shame because I just bought this. I was really pleased to...
What do you have on your hands?
So you got a new haircut?
Wait a minute, how do you go on Facebook, then?
Then how do you go on Snapchat?
Hello Lionel, Stephane on live, I'm near to Arthur
Arthur! How are you? Can I call you Arthur?
He’s the first case of technophobia on the planet, allergic to all things technological.
So can you tell us about your daily life after coming down with this disease?
No, l don’t want to talk about it.
And porn sites! How do you deal with them?
Great. Just what I needed. Fuck!
I just want to get a book that right there. Just one book!
Arthur. If you don’t want to work for whatever reason I don’t know of, fine.
But you could at least make an effort to attend our staff meetings.
I sent you an email last week.
I can’t check my email anymore, sir.
Then soon you won’t be able to see you paycheck, either!
Arthur! What’s up? We haven’t seen each other for ages.
You still have that weird thing?
Damn, it’s so good to see you!
I don’t see anybody anymore. It’s crazy! I’m so bored.
Now I’m reduced to reading synopsis on the backs of my DVD...
Yeah, same here. You weren’t there at Charlotte’s birthday yesterday night.
It was great. Why didn’t you come?
I didn’t know. You guys did something?
What? But you were on the Facebook event.
But I can’t go on Facebook.
I also sent you an SMS.
I can’t use my phone, Yann.
Sorry, I have to go. Call me, okay? Call me.
Okay Google, where do I live?
Motherfuck! Where the hell is it?
Sorry for missing your birthday, Grandma.
No, don’t worry about it. You were busy, it’s fine.
It’s a pleasure to see you, Arthur. It’s kind of you to come by.
How do you live without technology?
No technology, no computers, no GPS…
It’s an electronic map that tells you where to go.
I can’t give you any advice for your disease.
But I might have a few things for you.
They might be of some help to you.
Yann! It works! I can hear your voice!
Shit, I can hear your voice and you’re not in the same room. This thing is amazing!
Buddy, we have to meet up. Tonight, I’m holding a party.
Buddy, I was an asshole for not taking your thing seriously.
So here. A present to say that I’m sorry.
So, usually you don’t need to recharge it frequently.
And you can activate it like this.
And then you zoom in like this.
Exactly. Everything is touch-operated. You turn the pages like this.
It’s not xHamster but it’s the best that I could find.
Note : I’m in the archive room.
It’s a mess in here. Everything needs to be arranged. Really…
Did you come across the contract from our Chinese supplier, by any chance?
Yes, are you looking for something?
Arthur, you’ve heard a lot about you these last few weeks.
You are officially the first recorded case of technophobia.
Can you explain to us what that means?
So, I can no longer touch computers, tablets, smartphones, nothing at all.
All of the young viewers watching us now would consider that a real nightmare.
They are right, in a way.
No, you cheated! Show me your cards!
So you’re not going to buy the latest iPhone?
No, not at all. For this, I’ll be able to save some money instead.
No, I don’t want it! Put it down. It’s your now. It’s a present.
How do we live with technophobia?
How do we live with technophobia?

comments.author: SAMiR SAHEL

comments.text:
C'est trés prometteur. Mais je trouve que le message est encore trop 
premier degré. J'imagine que le jeune public y sera sensible. Mais pour un 
vieux trentenaire, le pitch est trop surligné (la technophobie est 
expliquée au moins 5 fois), trop prévisible et la morale passéiste manque 
de subtilité. Le côté "Ah! avant d'être parasités par la technologie on 
échangeait plus!" bullshit!

D'autant que ce qui me frappe dans ce sketch, c'est justement l'inverse: la 
distinction  entre la technologie récente et les vieilles technologies est 
artificielle: les apple, Instagram etc ne changent pas la vie mais ne la 
pourrissent pas non plus- il ne sont que de nouveaux avatars. La preuve que 
rien ne change? la soirée "sans technologie" d'Arthur est en fait le comble 
de la soirée hipster. Polaroid, vinyls, collages vintages... il manquait 
plus qu'un vieux fixie de l'armée néerlandaise dans un coin. On voit bien 
qu'il n'y a pas d'opposition entre l'ancienne et la nouvelle technologie et 
que notre époque n'a en fait jamais été autant nostalgique et rétrograde - 
quelque soit le support.

Bref, c'est bien mais il y a encore un peu de progrès dans l'écriture pour 
arriver au niveau de la poésie d'un Flober ou des raisonnements géniaux 
d'un Louis CK﻿
